title: Reports
text:

Cardiovascular

Coarctation of the aorta
Common truncus
Double outlet right ventricle
Ebstein anomaly
Hypoplastic left heart syndrome
Interrupted aortic arch
Pulmonary valve atresia and stenosis
Single ventricle
Teratology of fallot
Total anomalous pulmonary venous Return
Transposition of the great arteries
Tricuspid valve atresia and stenosis



Central Nervous System

Anencephaly
Spina bifida without anencephalus
Encephalocele



Chromosomal

Trisomy 13
Trisomy 18
Trisomy 21 (Down syndrome)

Genitourinary

Craniosynostosis

Limb Deficiencies
Omphalocele



Orofacial

Cleft Lip
Cleft Palate

title: Analysis and Collection Information
text:
Data analysis methods
Data collection methods

title: The Alaska Birth Defect Registry
text:
Established in January 1996 under the Alaska Administrative Code (7AAC 27.012), ABDR is a passive surveillance program that collects and provides information on the number of infants with birth defects born to Alaska residents. Birth defect reports are limited to conditions identified within the first three years of life. The ABDR relies on semiannual reporting from hospitals, health insurance companies, and diagnostic laboratories operating in Alaska.



The ABDR gathers information on several defects,including all 47 conditions recommended by the National Birth Defects Prevention (NBDPN).



Who: Any organization that provides service to or collects, and maintains records of service to children under the age of three with any of the conditions listed below. When: Organizations are expected to report all indicated conditions semiannually (every six months). What: Please include data for:
• All of the divisions and / or business segments of your organization. - In-patient, outpatient, admits, discharges, radiology, laboratory, specialty clinics, etc.
• All individuals seen by your organization up until their 3rd birthday. (Date of Service – Date of Birth) <3
• All of the ICD-10 CM codes listed in the following tables.



Alaska Birth Defect Registry data collection and analysis methods



Additional information from resources beyond the registry

Anchorage, AK 99503
